title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The financial squeeze that started about six months ago for nontraditional lenders is getting worse, contrasting sharply with recent rallies in stocks and corporate bonds.

Some of the world's most influential institutions are selling shares of Asia's tech giants after owning them for years, a troubling sign for investors after what has already been a painful market selloff.

Investors appear increasingly confident that the Fed will be able to cool inflation while avoiding the "hard landing" of a deep and prolonged economic downturn.

Binance recently made a commitment to transparency, but has a long way to go before it discloses enough meaningful information to give investors confidence in its future, accounting and financial specialists say.

Gaming in the cloud is a key piece of the FTC's lawsuit to block Microsoft's purchase of Activision.

What's News: Business & Finance
